meanings.definition: Grim: forbidding or uninviting in appearance
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house had a grimmer look with its boarded-up windows.
meanings.sent2: The storm clouds grew grimmer as the day went on.
meanings.sent3: The grimmer sky seemed to frown down on the picnic, threatening rain.
meanings.sent4: Her grimmer expression was like a dark cloud hanging over the room.
meanings.sent5: The grimmer landscape was devoid of any signs of life, casting a sense of desolation.

meanings.definition: Grim: harsh or stern in manner
meanings.sent1: The teacher's grimmer tone silenced the chatty students.
meanings.sent2: His grimmer attitude towards mistakes made the team nervous.
meanings.sent3: Despite his grimmer demeanor, he had a soft spot for kittens.
meanings.sent4: Her grimmer gaze could make even the bravest person feel small.
meanings.sent5: The grimmer boss rarely praised his employees, keeping them on edge.

meanings.definition: Grim: causing feelings of sadness or worry
meanings.sent1: The news of the accident cast a grimmer shadow over the family.
meanings.sent2: The grimmer reality of the situation finally sank in.
meanings.sent3: Even in the grimmer moments, she found a reason to smile.
meanings.sent4: The grimmer memories haunted him in the quiet of the night.
meanings.sent5: The grimmer outcome left everyone feeling somber and reflective.

meanings.definition: Grim: a facial expression showing disapproval or displeasure
meanings.sent1: His grimmer look warned others not to disturb him.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her grimmer expression when she heard the news.
meanings.sent3: The grimmer frown on his face softened when he saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: Her grimmer glare made it clear she was not pleased with the situation.
meanings.sent5: The grimmer scowl on his face made everyone uneasy in the room.
